snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Saturday, selections include the Drug Enforcement Administration complaining that it could not intercept messages between Apple devices...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Saturday, selections include the Drug Enforcement Administration complaining that it could not intercept messages between Apple devices because of the encryption, a Microsoft official saying Facebook Home reminds him of Windows Phone when it was unveiled two years ago and Bill Moyers on the poverty that goes with the wealth in Silicon Valley.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Silicon Valley Poverty and Verizon Contracts
